name: 吳欣怡
objective:
本課程開授之目標，在讓修習之學生能將鐵道車輛之工程技術與跨領域設計相互融合，在工程分析面能配合跨領域人文設計之需求，並在人文設計面瞭解工程之規範與要求。本課程內容包括鐵道車輛之系統基本架構、鐵道車輛結構及動態之基本工程分析技術、鐵道車輛車廂之功能性設計、及鐵道人文文化；本課程並配合軌道單位之校外參訪，讓課堂所學能與實務技術融合。本課程是以跨院合授的方式，由鐵道車輛技術研發中心、車輛系、文化事業發展系之師資共同參與授課。
This course aims to provide students the knowledge of engineering technology and interdisciplinary design for railway vehicles.  Design of railway vehicles should consider both the engineering and interdisciplinary cultural design at the same time.  A designer should consider not only engineering regulations and requirements, but also concepts of cultural design.  This course covers basic introduction of railway vehicle system, basic analysis of vehicle structures and dynamics, vehicle interior and exterior functional design, and railway culture.  The industrial tour in this course helps students to realize the theoretical and practical parts of railway vehicles.  This course is a joint lecture instructed by professional faculties from Railway Vehicle Research Center, Department of Vehicle Engineering, and Department of Cultural Vocation Development.

name: 黃秀英
objective:
The course focuses on the fundamental theory and concept of "Engineering Optimization Methods", "Linear Programming", "Nonlinear Programming", "Multi-objective Function Optimization", "Modern Mathematical Planning Methods", and "Cross-Attribute System Optimization." Hands-on practices using optimization software, and term projects are some key elements. Students will report out their own term project at the end of the semester. 

In this semester, University Social Responsibility (USR) concept is brought into the class. Encourage student to participate the USR project. Guide students to apply the optimization method in the thinking and planning process. Through the study, students can have better understanding about the optimization principle and apply it to the daily activities. It is expected that students can apply what have learned in the classes to their own daily activities, vehicle design, and research applications; and combine USR project into the term projects. (Taught in English)
schedule:
a. Week   b. Topic
1	Syllabus and Introduction to Design (Ch1) -- A general overview of the 
        course. The USR program is introduced into the class. Off-campus visits 
        to county-side schools will be arranged. Students are encouraged to
        participate in the USR project. Guide students to apply optimal methods in
        the planning and design of the USR program.
2	Optimum Design Problem Formulation (Ch2)
3	Optimum Design Problem Formulation (Ch2) -- Arrange USR model car 
        for 3D printing utilizing lightweight optimization design approach for the
        coming Friday USR activities.
4	Graphical Optimization (Ch3) -- Introduce the concept and application of
        lightweight design. With limited materials, using USR project’s target
        vehicle as an example (for the USR preparation), we optimize/reduce
        vehicle materials.
5	Optimum Design Concepts (Ch4) -- introducing the design concept for
        electric vehicles. Using the commercial codes for optimization design 
        analysis to improve the strength of the body structure of the USR project’s
        target vehicle. 
6	Optimum Design Concepts: Global & Lagrange Multipliers (Ch4)
7	Optimum Design Concepts: KKT (Ch5)
8	Linear Programming: Initial Basic Feasible Solution (Ch6) -- Lightweight 
        USR vehicle is arranged on the coming Friday activities.
9	Linear Programming (Ch6)
        Midterm Exam.
        Define project.  Report outline due next week.
10	Linear Programming: Duality (Ch7);
        Numerical Methods for Unconstrained Design (Ch8)
11	Numerical Methods for Unconstrained Design (Ch 8&9)
12	Numerical Methods for Unconstrained Design (Ch9) -- Arrange field trip to
        introduce USR program and electric vehicles to promote off-campus 
        teaching
13	Numerical Methods for Constrained Design (Ch10) -- Invite industry
        experts to share, introduce the design of electric vehicles, and how to use
        the USR vehicle as an example to conduct various optimization design
        and analyses.
14	Numerical Methods for Constrained Design (Ch 10&11)
15	Numerical Methods for Constrained Design (Ch11)
16	Practical Design Optimization (Others)
17	Project Presentation -- Groups participating in the USR project report their
        optimal design for different systems, and/or sub-systems.
18	Class Review & Final Exam --  After the final exam of the semester, 2 field
        trips for USR program are arranged to promote the application of electric
        vehicles.
